poem:
Title: "In the Halls of Power's Strife"

Through NBC's revolving door,
Ronna McDaniel seeks reprise,
While Liz Cheney roars with static,
Sculpts an echo of despise.
Depravity danced in the ballot's fog,
False prophets, they indulged the jest,
Embracing shadows that danced, consumed,
In the quest with no rest.
Yet integrity cries, "Fair and square!"
A whisper in the deafening fight,
All while power's hounds rage on,
In this perpetual, partisan night.
